channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Trapped and terrified': warnings as Sudanese militia advance on Darfur city
item.description: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim they've seized the Sudanese army's last base in El Fasher, Darfur — trapping hundreds of thousands and...

item.title: Finland's stubbornly low birth rate shows why a population shift may be inevitable
item.description: Famous for baby boxes and expansive pro-family policies, Finland continues to see one of the lowest birth rates in Europe, as a case study in how poli...

item.title: A Confederate statue toppled in Washington, D.C., in 2020 has been reinstalled
item.description: A statue of Confederate general Albert Pike, which had been pulled down during the Black Lives Matter movement, has been put back up in Washington, D....

item.title: Ireland's president-elect is a left-wing, anti-establishment figure who is outspoken on Gaza
item.description: Ireland's president for the next seven years is an independent lawmaker who has long spoken in support of Palestinians and has been vocal about her di...

item.title: Who is Doug Ford, the Canadian politician pushing Trump's buttons?
item.description: In his first campaign to lead Ontario, Ford started out as a Trump-style populist. But tariffs changed his view and he is now a consistent thorn in th...

item.title: Political violence has gripped the U.S. Experts say it's not as simple as left and right.
item.description: A nationwide string of threats and violent acts present a problem experts say is politically more complex than it seems.

item.title: Hamas expands search for remaining hostages' bodies in Gaza
item.description: Under the fragile U.S.-brokered ceasefire reached on Oct. 10, Hamas is expected to return all of the remains of Israeli hostages.

item.title: Missed paychecks, benefit lapses increase pressure for shutdown deal
item.description: The government shutdown stretched into Day 27 on Monday as the stalemate over how to reopen the government continues. Follow live updates here.

item.title: 1 dead, 6 injured in shooting at Lincoln University homecoming event
item.description: Officials say one student and one graduate are among the people injured in the shooting at Lincoln University in Pennsylvania.

item.title: Cameroon's 92-year-old president wins controversial eighth term
item.description: Paul Biya retains his title as the world's oldest head of state, in an election marred with violence and allegations of fraud.

item.title: Ivory Coast president, 83, secures fourth term after two rivals barred
item.description: Alassane Ouattara's win is unsurprising as his biggest rivals were barred from contesting the election.

item.title: Jamaica in path of 'life-threatening' category five Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Melissa, which has already been blamed for the deaths of four people, could become the strongest hurricane ever to hit Jamaica.

item.title: Trump will meet Japan’s new prime minister and address US troops in next stop on Asia trip
Here's when Sean "Diddy" Combs is expected to be released from prison
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs is expected to be released from a New York federal prison on May 8, 2028, according to online records from the Bureau of Prisons.

item.title: Freed Israeli hostage forced to dig own grave is 'growing back to his old self', father says
item.description: Evyatar David's health is "improving every day", his father says as his son and two other hostages freed by Hamas are discharged from hospital.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing can wear street clothes in court amid ‘extraordinary’ attention
item.description: A Utah judge has ruled that the 22-year-old man charged with killing Charlie Kirk can appear in court wearing street clothes but must be physically re...

item.title: Israel receives body Hamas says belongs to Gaza hostage
item.description: The remains of 15 hostages who died on or after the 7 October attacks have so far been returned to Israel.

item.title: Trump administration posts notice that no federal food aid will go out Nov. 1
